content: Always use type hints in Python function signatures for better IDE support and documentation. Example: def process_data(items: list[dict]) -> dict:
Use dataclasses for data containers instead of plain dictionaries. They provide type safety, auto-generated __init__, and better IDE support.
Prefer pathlib.Path over os.path for file operations. It provides a cleaner, more Pythonic API and better cross-platform compatibility.
Never use eval() to parse JSON data. Always use json.loads() to prevent remote code execution vulnerabilities.
Use httpx with explicit timeouts (connect, read, write, pool) to prevent hanging requests. Default 5s timeout may be insufficient for slow services.
